org.jtrim.swing.component

Class AsyncImageDisplay<ImageAddress>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • org.jtrim.swing.component.Graphics2DComponent
            • org.jtrim.swing.component.AsyncRenderingComponent
              • org.jtrim.swing.component.AsyncImageDisplay<ImageAddress>
  • Type Parameters:
    ImageAddress - the type of the address of the image to be displayed. That is, the input of the image query.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleAsyncImageDisplay
    Deprecated. 
    This class is very inefficient, use TransformedImageDisplay instead. Defines a Swing component which is able to display an image applying a series of user defined transformations.

    There are three kind of properties you need to specify for this component:

    • The address of the image to be displayed. The address will be specified for the query used to retrieve the image. So the address can be any type, for example: java.net.URI. The address can be set by calling the setImageAddress method.
    • The AsyncDataQuery used to retrieve the image. The image is retrieved by the address specified previously. The query can be set by calling one of the setImageQuery methods.
    • The transformations which will be used to transform the image retrieved by the image query. These transformations can be set by calling one of the setImageTransformer methods. Note that multiple transformations can be applied to a given image in any order.

    Note that this component is an AsyncRenderingComponent and relies on an AsyncRenderer. Therefore it must be set before displaying this component, either by passing an AsyncRendererFactory to the appropriate constructor or by setting it later.

    This class is highly experimental and may see significant changes in the future.

    The thread-safety property of this component is the same as with any other Swing components. That is, instances of this class can be accessed only from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread after made displayable.


    @Deprecated
public class AsyncImageDisplay<ImageAddress>
extends AsyncRenderingComponent
    See Also:
    SimpleAsyncImageDisplay, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • AsyncImageDisplay

        public AsyncImageDisplay()
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a new AsyncImageDisplay without setting the AsyncRenderer to be used. Therefore the setAsyncRenderer must be called before displaying the component.

      • AsyncImageDisplay

        public AsyncImageDisplay(AsyncRendererFactory asyncRenderer)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a new AsyncImageDisplay using an AsyncRenderer created by the specified AsyncRendererFactory. Note however, that if you pass null for the argument of this constructor, you still have to call the setAsyncRenderer method before displaying the component.
        Parameters:
        asyncRenderer - the AsyncRendererFactory to be used to render this component. This argument can be null, in which case, the AsyncRendererFactory must be set later by the setAsyncRenderer method.

    • Method Detail

      • setInfLongRenderTimeout

        public void setInfLongRenderTimeout()
        Deprecated. 
        Disables additional rendering when the rendering takes too much time. That is, if this method is called, the displayLongRenderingState method will not be notified to do additional rendering regardless how much time the rendering takes.

        This method effectively invalidates any previous calls to the setLongRenderingTimeout. The long rendering timeout can be enabled again by calling the setLongRenderingTimeout method.

        See Also:
        displayLongRenderingState, setLongRenderingTimeout

      • setLongRenderingTimeout

        public void setLongRenderingTimeout(long time,
                           java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeunit)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the timeout value after additional rendering may be applied to this component if after this timeout value the rendering does not complete.

        The default value for this property is infinite.

        The timeout value is measured from the start of the last requested rendering request and the additional rendering is applied until the rendering is fully completed.

        Parameters:
        time - the timeout value in the given time unit to wait until the displayLongRenderingState method is to be called. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        timeunit - the time unit of the specified timeout value. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified timeout value is not greater than or equal to zero
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified time unit is null

      • getImageMetaData

        public final ImageMetaData getImageMetaData()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the meta-data of the last retrieved image or null if the meta-data is not (yet) available. Note that if this component is never displayed, no attempt will be made to fetch the image, therefore this method will always return null.
        Returns:
        the meta-data of the last retrieved image or null if the meta-data is not (yet) available

      • getOldImageHideTimeout

        public final long getOldImageHideTimeout(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeunit)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the time need to elapse before clearing this component after changing the image (changing the address or the query.

        Note that this method may not return exactly the same value as set by a previous setOldImageHideTime method call due to rounding errors.

        Parameters:
        timeunit - the time unit of the result to be returned. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the time need to elapse before clearing this component after changing the image. This method always returns a value greater than or equal to zero.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified argument is null

      • setOldImageHideTime

        public final void setOldImageHideTime(long oldImageHideTime,
                       java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the time need to elapse before clearing this component after changing the image (changing the address or the query. That is, after the given amount of time elapses and no image is received by the image query, this component will be cleared with the currently set background color.

        The default value for this property is 1000 milliseconds.

        Parameters:
        oldImageHideTime - the time need to elapse before clearing this component after changing the image in the given time unit. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        timeUnit - the time unit of the specified timeout value. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified timeout value is not greater than or equal to zero
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified time unit is null

        Parameters:
        timeunit - the time unit in which to result is to be returned. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the time since the source image of this component has been changed
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified argument is null

        public final boolean isCurrentImageShown()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns true if the currently set image has been retrieved and was rendered to this component. This method will return true even if the image was only partially retrieved.
        Returns:
        true if the currently set image has been retrieved and was rendered to this component, false otherwise

      • getImageQuery

        public final org.jtrim.concurrent.async.AsyncDataQuery<? super ImageAddress,? extends ImageData> getImageQuery()
        Deprecated.

        Returns:

      • setImageQuery

        public final void setImageQuery(org.jtrim.concurrent.async.AsyncDataQuery<? super ImageAddress,? extends ImageData> imageQuery)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the image query to be used to retrieve the image and sets the image address to null.

        Calling this method is equivalent to calling setImageQuery(imageQuery, null). Therefore nothing will be displayed in this component, to display the image set the image address in a subsequent setImageAddress method call.

        This method will call listeners registered for notifications of changes of the image address.

        Parameters:
        imageQuery - the image query to be used to retrieve the image displayed by this component. This argument can be null, in which case no image is displayed and no transformation is applied.

      • setImageQuery

        public final void setImageQuery(org.jtrim.concurrent.async.AsyncDataQuery<? super ImageAddress,? extends ImageData> imageQuery,
                 ImageAddress imageAddress)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the image query to be used to retrieve the image and sets the image address to the given value.

        This method will call listeners registered for notifications of changes of the image address.

        Parameters:
        imageQuery - the image query to be used to retrieve the image displayed by this component. This argument can be null, in which case no image is displayed and no transformation is applied. Also note that if this argument is null. the specified image address must also be null.
        imageAddress - the object to be passed to the image query to retrieve the image. This argument can be null but if it is null, no attempt will be made to retrieve and display the image: This component will be simply cleared with the current background color.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - thrown if the specified image query is null but the image address is not null

      • setImageAddress

        public final void setImageAddress(ImageAddress imageAddress)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the address of the image to be displayed. This address is to be passed to the previously set image query.

        This method will call listeners registered for notifications of changes of the image address.

        Parameters:
        imageAddress - the address of the image to be displayed. This argument can be null but if it is null, no attempt will be made to retrieve and display the image (even if the query supports null inputs).

      • addImageListener

        public final org.jtrim.event.ListenerRef addImageListener(ImageListener listener)
        Deprecated. 
        Registers a listener which is to be notified whenever the source of the input image chages (i.e., the image query) or a new meta-data information is available. The meta-data will change after the image is attempted to be retrieved to be displayed.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener whose methods is to be called when the image source or the meta-data changes. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the ListenerRef object which can be used to unregister the currently added listener, so that it will no longer be notified of the changes. This method never returns null.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the ListenerRef object which can be used to unregister the currently added listener, so that it will no longer be notified of the changes. This method never returns null.

      • clearImageTransformers

        public void clearImageTransformers()
        Deprecated. 
        Removes every image transformations previously set by any of the setImageTransformer method calls. After this method call, no transformation will be applied to the retrieved image and it will be displayed as is.

      • removeImageTransformer

        public void removeImageTransformer(int index)
        Deprecated. 
        Removes a previously specified image transformer from the given index. Transformations on different index will be left untouched. If there is no transformation on the specified index, this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        index - the index from which the transformation is to be removed

      • setImageTransformer

        public void setImageTransformer(int index,
                       org.jtrim.cache.ReferenceType refType,
                       org.jtrim.concurrent.async.AsyncDataQuery<ImageTransformerData,TransformedImageData> imageTransformer)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the image transformer at the given index. This method replaces the image transformer previously set on the same index.

        Image transformers are defined by an AsyncDataQuery taking an ImageTransformerData for inputs and produces an ImageTransformerData as well. These image transformers are linked one after another each transforming the result of the previous image transformer. The order in which these image transformers are applied is specified by the index of the image transformer.

        Note: Do not attempt to cache the result of the passed image transformer, instead rely on the built in caching mechanism which is implemented in a way that it does not need to hold a hard reference to the input of the transformation.

        Parameters:
        index - the index of the currently added image transformer. Image transformers with lesser index are applied first. This argument is allowed to be any valid int value (including negative integers).
        refType - the reference type used to reference the cached result of the image transformation. The cache used is JavaRefObjectCache.INSTANCE. If you do not need caching pass ReferenceType.NoRefType. This argument cannot be null.
        imageTransformer - the image transformer to be applied. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the refType or the image transformer is null
        See Also:
        setImageTransformer(int, ReferenceType, ObjectCache, AsyncDataQuery)

      • setImageTransformer

        public void setImageTransformer(int index,
                       org.jtrim.cache.ReferenceType refType,
                       org.jtrim.cache.ObjectCache refCreator,
                       org.jtrim.concurrent.async.AsyncDataQuery<ImageTransformerData,TransformedImageData> imageTransformer)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the image transformer at the given index using the specified cache. This method replaces the image transformer previously set on the same index.

        Image transformers are defined by an AsyncDataQuery taking an ImageTransformerData for inputs and produces an ImageTransformerData as well. These image transformers are linked one after another each transforming the result of the previous image transformer. The order in which these image transformers are applied is specified by the index of the image transformer.

        Note: Do not attempt to cache the result of the passed image transformer, instead rely on the built in caching mechanism which is implemented in a way that it does not need to hold a hard reference to the input of the transformation.

        Parameters:
        index - the index of the currently added image transformer. Image transformers with lesser index are applied first. This argument is allowed to be any valid int value (including negative integers).
        refType - the reference type used to reference the cached result of the image transformation. The cache used is JavaRefObjectCache.INSTANCE. If you do not need caching pass ReferenceType.NoRefType. This argument cannot be null.
        refCreator - the ObjectCache used to cache the result of the image transformation. This argument can be null, in which case JavaRefObjectCache.INSTANCE is used.
        imageTransformer - the image transformer to be applied. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the refType or the image transformer is null
        See Also:
        setImageTransformer(int, ReferenceType, ObjectCache, AsyncDataQuery)

      • getDisplayedPointTransformer

        public final ImagePointTransformer getDisplayedPointTransformer()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the coordinate transformation between image coordinates and display coordinates according to the currently displayed image.

        The source coordinate system of the returned transformation is the coordinate system of the image and destination coordinate system is the coordinate system of the display. That is, transforming a coordinate from the source coordinates to the destination coordinate will transform the location of a pixel on the source image to the location of that pixel on this component. Note that the result may lay outside this component's bounds.

        This method always return the coordinate transformation according what is currently displayed on this component which may differ from the one which could be deduced from the currently set properties.

        Returns:
        the coordinate transformation between image coordinates and display coordinates according to the currently displayed image or null if the transformation is not (yet) available

      • getPointTransformer

        public ImagePointTransformer getPointTransformer()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the coordinate transformation between image coordinates and display coordinates according to the currently set properties or if it cannot be calculated, according to the displayed image.

        The source coordinate system of the returned transformation is the coordinate system of the image and destination coordinate system is the coordinate system of the display. That is, transforming a coordinate from the source coordinates to the destination coordinate will transform the location of a pixel on the source image to the location of that pixel on this component. Note that the result may lay outside this component's bounds.

        This method is intended to be overridden in subclasses which might be able to calculate the transformations based on other properties and does not have to wait until the image is rendered. The default implementation simply calls the getDisplayedPointTransformer() method.

        Returns:
        the coordinate transformation between image coordinates and display coordinates according to the currently set properties or if it cannot be calculated, according to the displayed image or null if the transformation is not (yet) available

      • displayLongRenderingState

        protected void displayLongRenderingState(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                             org.jtrim.concurrent.async.MultiAsyncDataState dataStates,
                             ImageMetaData imageMetaData)
        Deprecated. 
        Called when the rendering is still in progress and a given timeout elapsed. This method may update the display with addition information. Note however, that this method is called on the AWT Event Dispatch Thread and as such, should not do expensive computations.

        This method may be overridden in subclasses. The default implementation display some information of the image to be loaded and the current progress.

        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics2D to which this method need to draw to. This argument cannot be null. This method does not need to preserve the graphic context.
        dataStates - the current state of the image retrieving and rendering process. This state contains the state of the image retrieval process and all the applied transformations. This argument can never be null but can contain null states.
        imageMetaData - the meta data of the image currently being displayed. This argument can be null if the meta data is not available.

      • onRenderingError

        protected void onRenderingError(BasicRenderingArguments renderingArgs,
                    java.awt.image.BufferedImage drawingSurface,
                    ImageReceiveException exception)
        Deprecated. 
        Called when an exception occurred while trying to retrieve the image or during rendering the image. This method may update the specified drawing surface.

        This method is called in the context of the AsyncRenderer of this component and may do some more expensive computation without blocking the input of the user.

        This method may be overridden in subclasses. The default implementation displays the exception message in the upper left corner of the drawing surface (which is the upper left corner of this component).

        Parameters:
        renderingArgs - the properties of this component at the time when the rendering has been requested. This argument cannot be null.
        drawingSurface - the BufferedImage which needs to be updated to display the error. This argument cannot be null.
        exception - the exception describing the reason of failure. Note that, this exception might have causes (and suppressed exceptions) which need to be inspected to fully understand the causes.
